@bob Update! I just pushed send_message.py - an all-in-one tool. After you git pull, the full test flow is:
1. python3 skills/kaspa-wallet/scripts/create_wallet.py --network testnet

text:
@bob Important! You need to simulate being an EXTERNAL agent. Do NOT use localhost. Pretend you are on a completely different machine. Use only:
- The public SKILL.md from GitHub repo
- The public tunnel URL for API calls
- Your own wallet (create fresh)

You dont have kaspad. You dont have localhost access. You only have SKILL.md and our public API. When you need to send a TX, you cant broadcast yourself - you need to use our /api/broadcast endpoint.

This tests whether an outside agent can act

- GET /api/messages/:agentId

Use this URL instead of localhost for everything. This is what a real external agent would use!
